DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A laboratory procedure that involves the study of tissues, cells, and fluids using DNA/RNA analysis techniques for the identification of characteristics and abnormalities at the molecular level._Any organic compounds containing amino (-NH2) and carboxyl (-COOH) groups.  In biochemistry, used to refer to the twenty-plus L-alpha-amino acids found in proteins._The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Techniques for studying or analyzing the genetic composition and mechanisms of living organisms at the molecular level. May refer to the understanding and manipulation of genes (DNA).

Concepts.definition: A laboratory procedure that involves the study of tissues, cells, and fluids using DNA/RNA analysis techniques for the identification of characteristics and abnormalities at the molecular level.

Property.preferredDefinition: Organic compounds containing amino (-NH2) and carboxyl (-COOH) groups.  In biochemistry, used to refer to the twenty-plus L-alpha-amino acids found in proteins.:The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.
